tool.name: SAGA.shapes_tools.29
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayPOINTS False isArraySTRIKE False isArrayDIP False isArrayRAKE False isArraySIZE False output_data_PLOTS $output_data_PLOTS name SAGA.shapes_tools.29 POINTS $POINTS STRIKE $STRIKE DIP $DIP RAKE $RAKE SIZE $SIZE SIZE_DEF $SIZE_DEF SIZE_RANGE_MIN $SIZE_RANGE_MIN SIZE_RANGE_MAX $SIZE_RANGE_MAX DARC $DARC STYLE $STYLE prefer $prefer response $response outputType_PLOTS $OutputSection_PLOTS.outputType_PLOTS transmissionMode_PLOTS $OutputSection_PLOTS.transmissionMode_PLOTS

param.name: POINTS
param.label: Points
param.help: Points The following data types are allowed in the txt file: json, vnd.google-earth.kml+xml, xml

param.name: STRIKE
param.label: Strike
param.help: Strike The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: DIP
param.label: Dip
param.help: Dip The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: RAKE
param.label: Rake
param.help: Rake The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: SIZE
param.label: Size
param.help: Size The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_PLOTS
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_PLOTS
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: This tool creates a new polygon layer with beachball plots as representation of focal mechanism solution data. Focal mechanism data of earthquakes have to be supplied as strike and dip angles of the fault plane and rake angle (slip vector) as deviation from the strike angle.
